item.title: Star Trek Minus Context
item.description: #StarTrek

item.title: Beth Cimini
item.description:
If women gave up every time we got evidence people hate us or just don't even consider us people, nothing would ever get done.
So take a minute, feel/"honor" the awful feelings, because they're real, but then we're back to our regularly scheduled program of building the least-worst world we can.

item.title: myrmepropagandist
item.description: @Extra_Special_Carbon But people wrote stories and made art, they named SO MANY bugs and discovered so much about how nature worksâ€” they had families and remarkable lives in spite of all of that and you and I will do that too. Powerful men will thump their clubs. Maybe we arenâ€™t the kind of animals that can transcend that. I still kind of think we are, though. Because like a bit of grit in an oyster I wonâ€™t go away or stop being irritating. No. I will become a pearl.

item.title: Kyle Harrington
item.description: Alrighty folks, as promised in https://mastodon.social/@kisharrington/113273799367047306We have launched our cryoET object detection competition! Find it more info here: https://cryoetdataportal.czscience.com/competition. We have prizes (distributed via Kaggle)!Our preprint about the data, the annotations, and the competition prep is posted: https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/2024.11.04.621686v1Our tools preprint is also available: https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/2024.11.04.621608v1This has been a huge effort from folks at the CZ Imaging Institute and CZI! Good luck, and thank you for participating :)

item.title: Kyle Harrington
item.description: You can explore the experimental data on the CryoET Data portal here: https://cryoetdataportal.czscience.com/datasets/10440?deposition-id=10310and the synthetic data here: https://cryoetdataportal.czscience.com/datasets/10441?deposition-id=10310In the image, experimental data is on the left and synthetic data is on the right

item.title: Spencer LaVere Smith
item.description:
UCSB has a bunch of high level admin jobs all under search at the same time:
- a chancellor (for the first time in decades)
- a vice chancellor for research
- a dean for MLPS (math, life sciences, physics)
- a dean for the CCS (honors college)
- a dean and AVC for grad div
and more.There'll be some new faces soon. Yours?

item.title: Tim Hutton
item.description:
This shader shows the extent of your fovea on your visual field:
https://www.shadertoy.com/view/4dsXzM"Look at any specific point and you should clearly see the extent of your fovea (the stars only seem to be rotating in a small circle at the center of your vision). Move your head back and forth to see it grow/shrink. Works better in full screen mode."(You need to click the link, not look at the static image.)

item.title: Laffy
item.description: Via Dave Wasserman:Latest numbers: across the seven battleground states, the '20-'24 swing towards Trump was ~3.1 pts. Across the other 43 states (+DC), it was ~6.7 pts. Bottom line: the Harris campaign swam impressively against some very strong underlying currents.
